newsitem.title: THAILAND: Somprasong president gives up to police.
newsitem.headline: Somprasong president gives up to police.

text.p: The president of Somprasong Land Plc, Prasong Panichpakdi, turned himself in to police on Thursday for questioning on charges of falsifying his company's financial statements, police said.
He arrived at the Police Economic Crime Investigation Division headquarters in Bangkok in the late morning after a warrant of arrest for him was approved by the Interior Ministry last week.
"He will now be questioned," a police officer said but declined to comment further.
Property firm Somprasong's officials said they would not comment on the charges against the company president.
If he is found guilty, Prasong faces up to 10 years in jail and up to one million baht ($40,000) in fines.
Somprasong's shares have been suspended by the Thai bourse pending disclosures from the company.
Its share price has been hit in recent months by trader concerns over the company's liquidity position, brokers said.
